articles.title: Scientists Uncover 100,000 Submerged Mountains Beneath the Ocean Floor in Breakthrough Map - The Daily Galaxy
articles.description: New satellite data reveals nearly 100,000 submerged mountains, hidden beneath the surface. The implications for marine life and science are immense.
articles.content: In a revolutionary advancement in oceanography, scientists have created one of the most detailed maps of the ocean floor to date. The map, compiled using high-resolution data from the SWOT satellite,… [+3575 chars]

articles.title: "Wow! Just wow!" First images from NASA's latest space telescope, which will explore the first seconds of the Universe - BBC Sky at Night Magazine
articles.description: These images are the first views of the Universe by SPHEREx and came as scientists switched on its detectors in space for the first time.
articles.content:
"Our spacecraft has opened its eyes on the Universe," says Olivier Doré, project scientist for NASA's SPHEREx space telescope.

articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: The sky is brighter than astronomers imagined - Big Think
articles.description: The most famous Hubble images show glittering stars and galaxies amidst the black backdrop of space. But more was captured than we realized.
